page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Part of the land is cliff top so it is very rocky and difficult to cultivate but the four farmers whose land meets here use it for dairy cattle and grazing. They all grow grass for hay. Three of them grow grass for silage. One farmer manages to grow corn, potatoes, anemones, broccoli and various vegetables as well. All the farms own machinery including tractors but a silage cutter was owned by a syndicate. The problems for these farmers included E.E.C. policies, milk quotas, isolation from the rest of the country and the unreliable weather.
